Job Description


	Our client is seeking a results-driven Branch Manager to lead frontline sales operations, manage a high-volume team, and drive consistent commercial growth.
	The ideal candidate must have a strong sales background, the ability to train and motivate large teams, and a track record of performing in fast-paced environments.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily branch operations to ensure efficiency, operational excellence, and premium service delivery.
	Set sales targets, monitor performance, and drive the team to exceed revenue objectives.
	Develop and execute effective sales and marketing strategies to increase customer acquisition and brand visibility.
	Utilise CRM tools to track sales activities, manage customer data, and analyse performance metrics for informed decision-making.
	Prepare accurate sales, performance, and operational reports for management review.
	Lead, train, and motivate a large sales team to achieve high productivity and consistent results.
	Foster a culture of accountability, professionalism, and continuous improvement across the branch.
	Ensure strict compliance with organisational policies, processes, and customer service standards.
	Provide mentorship, coaching, and performance feedback to enhance staff capabilities and career growth.


Person Specification


	Master&rsquo;s degree (M.Sc./second degree highly preferred) in Business Administration, Marketing, Management, or a related field.
	3&ndash;5 years of hands-on experience in sales, including 2&ndash;4 years managing large teams (50&ndash;200+ staff).
	Proven track record of driving sales growth, achieving set targets, and leading successful marketing initiatives.
	Tech-savvy, with strong proficiency in CRM systems, reporting tools, and digital sales platforms.
	Strong leadership skills with demonstrated ability to manage people, resolve conflicts, and build high-performing teams.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and people-management skills.
	Ability to train, coach, and motivate sales staff at different performance levels.
	Strong analytical, organisational, and decision-making abilities.


Annual Net Remuneration
Competitive &amp; Attractive.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;talentsearch@firstexcelsia.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;Branch Manager&rdquo; as the subject of the email.",

Branch Manager Job at First Excelsia Professional Services Limited




        
    

        
        First Excelsia Professional Services Limited - Our client, a premium herbal products brand with nationwide reach is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Branch Manager

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Health & Wellness

Job Description

	Our client is seeking a results-driven Branch Manager to lead frontline sales operations, manage a high-volume team, and drive consistent commercial growth.
	The ideal candidate must have a strong sales background, the ability to train and motivate large teams, and a track record of performing in fast-paced environments.


Key Responsibilities


	Oversee daily branch operations to ensure efficiency, operational excellence, and premium service delivery.
	Set sales targets, monitor performance, and drive the team to exceed revenue objectives.
	Develop and execute effective sales and marketing strategies to increase customer acquisition and brand visibility.
	Utilise CRM tools to track sales activities, manage customer data, and analyse performance metrics for informed decision-making.
	Prepare accurate sales, performance, and operational reports for management review.
	Lead, train, and motivate a large sales team to achieve high productivity and consistent results.
	Foster a culture of accountability, professionalism, and continuous improvement across the branch.
	Ensure strict compliance with organisational policies, processes, and customer service standards.
	Provide mentorship, coaching, and performance feedback to enhance staff capabilities and career growth.


Person Specification


	Master’s degree (M.Sc./second degree highly preferred) in Business Administration, Marketing, Management, or a related field.
	3–5 years of hands-on experience in sales, including 2–4 years managing large teams (50–200+ staff).
	Proven track record of driving sales growth, achieving set targets, and leading successful marketing initiatives.
	Tech-savvy, with strong proficiency in CRM systems, reporting tools, and digital sales platforms.
	Strong leadership skills with demonstrated ability to manage people, resolve conflicts, and build high-performing teams.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and people-management skills.
	Ability to train, coach, and motivate sales staff at different performance levels.
	Strong analytical, organisational, and decision-making abilities.


Annual Net Remuneration
Competitive & Attractive.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: talentsearch@firstexcelsia.com using “Branch Manager” as the subject of the email.

HR / Admin Officer Job at Amitouch Global Concepts Limited




        
    

        
        Amitouch Global Concepts Limited is a 360- degree marketing and brand communications agency based in Lagos, Nigeria. The company specializes in Above The Line (ATL) and Below The Line (BTL) marketing communications, offering services such as strategy development, traditional and digital media, experiential marketing, event organization, and management. Their mission is to provide customized brand marketing and sales activities that lead to actual sales, filling a market gap in Nigeria's marketing services.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR / Admin Officer

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT) and Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Responsibilities


	Assist in the full recruitment cycle (job posting, screening, interviewing coordination, and onboarding).
	Maintain and update employee records, HR databases, and personnel files.
	Prepare employment contracts, letters, and HR-related documents.
	Support performance management processes and training coordination.
	Handle employee queries related to HR policies, leave, attendance, and benefits.
	Track employee attendance, leave records, and maintain HRMIS updates.
	Assist with payroll data compilation and monthly submissions.
	Support employee engagement activities and company events.
	Ensure compliance with local labor laws and internal HR policies.


Administrative Duties:


	Oversee general office management (supplies, maintenance, vendor coordination).
	Manage office facilities and ensure a safe, clean, and organized work environment.
	Coordinate travel arrangements, meetings, and company logistics.
	Handle incoming and outgoing correspondence, documentation, and filing systems.
	Assist in procurement processes and asset inventory management.
	Prepare administrative reports and support management in operational tasks.


Required Qualifications & Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	2–4 years of experience in HR and/or administrative roles.
	Strong understanding of HR practices and basic knowledge of labor laws.
	Proficiency in MS Office and HRIS systems.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
	Strong organizational and time-management abilities.
	High level of professionalism, confidentiality, and attention to detail.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidate should send their CV to: melville.amitouch@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

	This senior role reports to the Chief Operating Officer (COO), and is critical to protecting the company's capital base, ensuring regulatory compliance, and supporting sustainable growth across our lending and investment products.
	The successful candidate must possess deep expertise in managing risk within the specialized Nigerian financial services landscape.


Responsibilities
The Head of Risk Management will be responsible for designing, implementing, and overseeing the firm's entire Risk Management Framework (RMF), with a focus on:


	Strategic Oversight: Establishing the institution's risk appetite, policies, and limits across all business units in line with Board directives and regulatory requirements (CBN).
	Credit Risk Management: Leading the assessment, monitoring, and mitigation of credit exposure within the loan portfolio, including setting underwriting standards, developing stress testing models, and managing loan loss provisioning.
	Liquidity and Market Risk: Monitoring funding sources, managing liquidity gaps, and evaluating exposure to interest rate and currency fluctuations inherent in the NBFI operating model.
	Operational and Technology Risk: Identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks arising from internal processes, human error, system failures, and cybersecurity threats, crucial for our operations.
	Regulatory Compliance: Serving as the central point of contact for risk-related regulatory matters, ensuring timely reporting and strict adherence to all CBN and statutory guidelines.
	Reporting & Governance: Preparing and presenting comprehensive risk reports to the Board Risk Committee and Executive Management, detailing key risk exposures and mitigation actions.


Mandatory Requirements


	Qualifications: A Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Economics, Quantitative Analysis, or a related field. An MBA or Master’s degree is advantageous.
